---
title: "Encrypting data with R"
output: html_notebook
---

Importation of the libraries
```{r}
library(encryptr)
```

Generation of both private and public keys
```{r}
genkeys() ## Generates both public and private keys in current directory
```

Let's first try with encrypting a vector. more precisely a string.
```{r}
encrypted_name <- "Hello :)" %>%
  encrypt_vec(public_key_path = "./id_rsa.pub") ## By default, will check for id_rsa.pub in the current directory

```

Now that's encrypted, let's decrypt it.

```{r}
encrypted_name %>%
  decrypt_vec(private_key_path = "./id_rsa")
```

As simple as that, the encrypted character string has been decrypted back to its original form.
